title: Which are the top ten events in American history? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: 1) independence - US became a nation2) constitution - a liberal and republican country with the idea of 'separating powers '3) Luisanna Purchase - the start of west expansion4) Civil Wal - solve the tension of slavery5) West Expansion - from a small country of 13 states to a continental power6) Industrilisation - boom in economy and technology, the U.S. started to dominate the world7) WWI - from isolationism to independent internationalism - involved in world affair8) Great Depreesion - the start of government interventions on the economy - growing roles of the federal government 9) WWII - stability as it was far away from the batterfield- Europe went down and US grew up10) Cold War - Big Head

"Top Ten" in what context? We cannot answer usefully without more context... And how granular do you want your "events" 1. Independence and founding (1750-1800 in general)2. US Civil War and the way it shaped interstate relations3. Stock Market Crash and Great Depression4. Second World War5. Development and deployment of THE Bomb6. The Cold War, including the space/arms race, flash-points, The Wall, and the eventual collapse of the USSR7. The Space Race, specifically the Moon Landing efforts8. Civil Rights Movement9. Vietnam Conflict backlash/aftermath and end of mandatory military service10. Global War On Terror (from 11 September 2011 to present day) I'd love to defend my points if anyone wants to make it a conversation...
